result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Justin Dennis Krizan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

Court costs of $543.00 only.
Defendant to meet with the payment clerk to discuss remaining balance.
Atty Hefty and Atty Nelson waive attorney fees.

records.addlTxt:
TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CM142, 18CF111, 18CF482, 18CF730 (PLEAH) and 19CT246 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. Selena P. appears via phone for Victim Witness. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood appears in the Courtroom   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson and DF:  Justin Dennis Krizan appeared by video from Atty Nelson's office. Case called at 9:36 a.m. Court has reviewed files and requesting status. Atty Nelson recites agreement. PSI requested. 18CF111 has concluded. Believes 16CM142 is also completed. Court requesting confirmation as deferred was revoked and does not look like DE was sentenced. Requesting State for a status on that file. Atty Nelson states 19CT246 is not part of the agreement and no resolution at this time.  ADA Ellenwood requesting restitution in the amount of $2,008.32 payable to SCSO on 18CF482. State is in compliance with Victim's Rights.  Atty Nelson states that amount was not disclosed and will argue. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 14 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety in 18CF482. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reviews right with DE to be present in the Courtroom for today's hearing. DE understands and would like to continue via video. DE confirms he is able to hear and understand clearly. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct. 14 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety in 18CF482. On motion of the State without objection, Ct's 1 thru 13 and Ct. 15 in 18CF482 are read in and dismissed. 18CF730 read in and dismissed. Court will order PSI report. Report due by 8-03-2020. Any alternate PSI's to be filed the same date. 19CT246 will be scheduled for a status conference. Atty Nelson will submit an application for DE into St Croix County Treatment Court. Court schedules for sentencing.
Plea hearing on May 12, 2020 at 09:30 am.
Review on October 15, 2018 at 07:45 am.

Apprs:  CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson DF:  Justin Dennis Krizan appeared. Case called at 9:17.  Includes 18FO66,16CM142, 17CM831, 18CF111, 18CF332,18CF347, 18CM317. ADA Ellenwood updates the Court. DE has a new case in Branch 4. Court will set an internal review for 30 days to see what the status is of these cases. Bonds continue in form and amount.  Review scheduled for October 15, 2018 at 07:45 am.
Def's copy of NOH for FPT returned from PO; Attempted not known. km
Final pre-trial on September 14, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Erica Ellenwood DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson DF:  Justin Dennis Krizan appeared. Case called at 8:22.  Includes 16CM142(PTC), 17CM831(PTC), 18CF111(PTC), 18CM317(PTC),18CF332(ARGN), 18CF347(ARGN), 18FO66(STC). On 18CF332 and 18CF347 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. NG on all counts. Waives speedy trial. Atty. Nelson updates the court. Bonds continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2018 at 09:00 am.

__SIGNATURE BOND:   X- Defendant and/or  __ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.  AMENDED -  Includes 16CM142, 18CF332, 18CF347

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Nancy N.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Court premits parties to communicate through Our Family Wizard only. The parties are not to talk about cases at all. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Sabrina A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. I further understand that I am required to submit to random ALCOHOL testing, at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Erica Ellenwood  with student intern Holly Hatch DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson DF: Justin Dennis Krizan appeared. Case called at 10:10. Includes 16CM142(STC), 18CF332(PH), 18CF347(PH). S/T Deputy Nick Krueger and Officer Thomas Mann Jr. Direct by ADA Ellenwood of Deputy Krueger. Cross by Atty. Nelson. Direct by ADA Ellenwood of Officer Mann. Officer Mann identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Nelson. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood. Recross by Atty. Nelson. ADA Ellenwood requests the Court to take judicial notice of bonds. Ex. #1 and Ex. #2 O/R. On18CF332 Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. On 18CF347 Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. On 16CM142 Dr. Steve Benson out of Wausau has completed an evaluation. Victim makes a request for NAC. ADA Ellenwood makes argument. Atty. Nelson responds. Court premits parties to communicate through Our Family Wizard only. The parties are not to talk about cases at all. VW will assist in geting the victim set up through Our Famly Wizard. Court reviews the no contact order with the victim.  Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2018 at 08:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nancy N.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Joseph Caton, DF:  Justin Dennis Krizan appeared from jail. Defendant states early Monday's or Tuesday's work the best for scheduling if a new date is needed to accomodate a court appointed atty. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 08:00 am.
